Hello,

you reached my coding page.
Before you dive into the projects, let me explain what programming means to me and why I spend so much time with it. Using Processing I learned that the computers we use have more power I could ever imagine. All these repetitive tasks I do day to day could be done by the machine if I know how to talk to it. With this kind of "laziness" in mind I started automating InDesign layouts and developing tools for After Effects to support my workflows. All that lead me to writing my B.A. Thesis about automation and publishing scripts on aescripts.com and github.com I'm not a "programmer". I'm an autodidact coder that comes from the design and I want to keep it that way. But enough of that chit chat.
See my favorite programming projects below.

Geographic Visualization

While studying at the FH Potsdam I took interest in plotting data onto interactive maps. For a project in the field of "Design of Software Interfaces" I have been part of a team that developed a concept and wrote a mockup for a disaster management software for the maeve table. This was the starting point for understanding maps and location data. Based on this knowledge I developed Locations.jsx and AEMap.jsx for Adobe After Effects that allow the creation animations with location based data.

Locations
AEMap
Tangible Maps

Programming Typography

During my studies I became a member of the group Grenzfarben. Together with them I produced, since 2008, several product catalogues for JustMusic and Sound Service. We started out working in Quark Express and had to format every paragraph of these catalogues, that have more than 300 pages and 5000 to 7000 products, by hand. When we made the switch to InDesign I was tired of clicking. So I tried to automate the process with JavaScript/ExtendScript. It worked. Now we have a semiautomatic process that gives us more time for design and I never stopped writing scripts. Here you will find Swissd.jsx and Monoline Text.jsx for After Effects together with a workshop I gave at the FHPotsdam about Typography & Automation and a semiautomatic process that imports my project data from [Incom.org](https://incom.org/start) into a Layout.

Hersheys Monoline Text
Swissd
Typography and Automation
Incom.org 2 Layout

/ˌmisəˈlānēəs/ Adjective
1. (of items or people gathered or considered together) Of various types or from different sources.
2. (of a collection or group) Composed of members or elements of different kinds: "a miscellaneous collection".
